Can someone explain to me why the Mun looks like this? I was not aware it had an atmosphere.

There's a kind of opaque 'cloud' layer (i.e. an extremely low-res shell of the mun that looks nice at a distance but kinda terrible nearby) that suddenly disappears in a circle around the camera at ~4 km? It's making it pretty hard to see the ground I want to land on.

I have v5 medium res installed.

Can someone explain to me why the Mun looks like this? I was not aware it had an atmosphere.

There's a kind of opaque 'cloud' layer (i.e. an extremely low-res shell of the mun that looks nice at a distance but kinda terrible nearby) that suddenly disappears in a circle around the camera at ~4 km? It's making it pretty hard to see the ground I want to land on.

I have v5 medium res installed.

I had the same issue when using EVE 7.1. When i installed EVE 7.3 the issue was resolved.

Hope it helps

I had the same issue when using EVE 7.1. When i installed EVE 7.3 the issue was resolved.

Hope it helps

It has!

I found that setting the fadedist to 120 was just enough to fix it... well, to make that layer of atmosphere disappear from near-ground view.7.3 seems to set the fadedist at 200 by default (and the scaled fadedist at 1000).

Thanks for the tips

yep, no BA clouds, just EVE clouds, and I DID do a clean install

well im out, have you actualy deleted files from game folder and downloaded a new though, i dont think the game is realizing there is a new mod installed

Hi, I'm trying to use Better Atmospheres to give Kerbin rings. But it isn't working, this is what I'm doing:

In the SaveLoad folder in the KittopiaSpace folder, i copied and pasted the Jool.cfg and made another one and renamed it Kerbin.cfg. Then i went into the new Kerbin.cfg and changed the "PlanetJool" near the top to "PlanetKerbin", and then saved and exited it. I then went into the Textures folder in the KittopiaSpace folder, deleted the kerbin_ring.png, copied and pasted the jool_ring.png and renamed it kerbin_ring.png. That's all i did, and when i start the game absolutely nothing is different. Could some one help me fix this problem? Thanks in advance.

Hi, I'm trying to use Better Atmospheres to give Kerbin rings. But it isn't working, this is what I'm doing:

In the SaveLoad folder in the KittopiaSpace folder, i copied and pasted the Jool.cfg and made another one and renamed it Kerbin.cfg. Then i went into the new Kerbin.cfg and changed the "PlanetJool" near the top to "PlanetKerbin", and then saved and exited it. I then went into the Textures folder in the KittopiaSpace folder, deleted the kerbin_ring.png, copied and pasted the jool_ring.png and renamed it kerbin_ring.png. That's all i did, and when i start the game absolutely nothing is different. Could some one help me fix this problem? Thanks in advance.

Because of the way Kittopiatech generates rings, you may have to experiment with the inner, and outer radius parameters. Iirc, kerbin should have an inner radius of something like 20000, and an outer radius of anything greater than that.
Huh, turns out the atmosphere actually does look kinda like that...

FWIW, Astronomer did it with his pack. (Note: this doesn't answer the question of if it's legal)

If he put it in there, and he was on Modding Mondays, then it's probably safe to do so. Though if somebody who knows if it's legal or not says otherwise, I'm taking it out instantly.

Just put the SharedAssets10.assets into your KSP_Data folder.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/txljqzh94c7qw1j/BAV5ASSET.zip

Im a big fan of this mod, dont get me wrong, But our sun is actually yellow when viewed from space.

The "yellow" appearance is due to the light passing through the Earth's atmosphere.

So I installed the mod and everything looks AMAZING. But I can't seem to get Kerbol to shine white. Is there a special place I should be sticking the .dds file?

Thanks!

So I installed the mod and everything looks AMAZING. But I can't seem to get Kerbol to shine white. Is there a special place I should be sticking the .dds file?

Thanks!

It requires using a Unity Explorer program (linked in the OP via another post) to replace it. Or, you could download the file TSG posted and put it in KSP_Data, overwriting the sharedassets10.assets file already there.

For mac users, the sharedassets10 file is accessed by right clicking KSP.app and selecting show package contents. It is in the contents/data folder

http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2013/07/07/article-2357946-1AB50783000005DC-377_968x637.jpg

The "yellow" appearance is due to the light passing through the Earth's atmosphere.

Would there be a way to make it so that it is yellow in the atmosphere and white outside?

For mac users, the sharedassets10 file is accessed by right clicking KSP.app and selecting show package contents. It is in the contents/data folder

Would there be a way to make it so that it is yellow in the atmosphere and white outside?

That's what we're working on. EVE currently doesn't allow us to make this effect work, but hopefully in the new version it will.
Thanks! I'll give that a whirl .
